biolockj

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.Log

  • public class Log
extends Object
    Simple Logging Facade for Java (SLF4J) implementation using Log4J
    Log4J Configuration: log4j.properties
    Every Java class that prints to the Java log file, will do so by calling:
    • get(Class).get(Class).debug( logMessage )
    • get(Class).get(Class).info( logMessage )
    • get(Class).get(Class).warn( logMessage )
    • get(Class).get(Class).error( logMessage, exception )

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected static String DEFAULT_FORMAT
      Standard BioLockJ log format includes date, time, severity type, and calling class before the msg.
      protected static String DIRECT_FORMAT
      Direct BioLockJ log prefix includes only the msg.
      protected static String LOG_APPEND
      Set in initialize(String) to true only if executing pipeline restart.
      Used by log4j.properties
      log4j.appender.file.Append=${LOG_APPEND}
      protected static String LOG_FILE
      Set in initialize(String) to file path of pipeline Java log file
      Used by log4j.properties
      log4j.appender.file.File=${LOG_FILE}
      protected static String LOG_FORMAT
      Set in initialize(String) to proper layout based on pipeline is direct or note
      Used by log4j.properties
      log4j.appender.file.layout.ConversionPattern=${LOG_FORMAT}
      static String LOG_LEVEL_PROPERTY
      Config property used to set log sensitivity in log4j.properties
      log4j.rootLogger=${project.logLevel}, file, stdout DEBUG - Log all messages INFO - Log info, warning and error messages WARN - Log warning and error messages ERROR - Log error messages only
      static String LOG_SPACER
      Spacer used to improve log file readability

      Print welcome message.
      Message includes BioLockJ version BioLockJUtil.getVersion(), lab citation, and freeware blurb.

    • Field Detail

      • LOG_LEVEL_PROPERTY

        public static final String LOG_LEVEL_PROPERTY
        Config property used to set log sensitivity in log4j.properties
        log4j.rootLogger=${project.logLevel}, file, stdout
        1. DEBUG - Log all messages
        2. INFO - Log info, warning and error messages
        3. WARN - Log warning and error messages
        4. ERROR - Log error messages only
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOG_SPACER

        public static final String LOG_SPACER
        Spacer used to improve log file readability
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_FORMAT

        protected static final String DEFAULT_FORMAT
        Standard BioLockJ log format includes date, time, severity type, and calling class before the msg. Example: 2018-05-27 19:53:04 INFO MetaUtil:
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIRECT_FORMAT

        protected static final String DIRECT_FORMAT
        Direct BioLockJ log prefix includes only the msg. Example: 2018-05-27 19:53:04 INFO MetaUtil:
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        protected static final String LOG_APPEND
        Set in initialize(String) to true only if executing pipeline restart.
        Used by log4j.properties
        log4j.appender.file.Append=${LOG_APPEND}
        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • debug

        public static void debug(Class<?> loggingClass,
                         String msg)
        Print log level DEBUG message.
        Do not print MetaUtil debug since these will always print since the Logger isn't initialized yet.
        Parameters:
        loggingClass - Logging class
        msg - Message to log

      • error

        public static void error(Class<?> myClass,
                         String msg,
                         Exception exception)
        Print log level ERROR message.
        Parameters:
        myClass - Logging class
        msg - Message to log
        exception - Cause of the error

      • get

        public static org.slf4j.Logger get(Class<?> callingClass)
        Returns the Logger for the callingClass. Each class has its own Logger since the callingClass name can be appended to the log file without impacting performance.
        Parameters:
        callingClass - Java class in need of Logger
        Returns:
        Logger for callingClass

      • getFile

        public static File getFile()
        Returns the log file.
        Returns:
        File logFile

      • getMsgs

        public static List<String> getMsgs()
        Get the logMesseges created prior to creating the actual LOG_FILE
        Returns:
        logMesseges

      • info

        public static void info(Class<?> myClass,
                        String msg)
        Print log level INFO message.
        Parameters:
        myClass - Logging class
        msg - Message to log

      • initialize

        public static void initialize(String name)
                       throws Exception
        Called by BioLockJ.main() after Config is initialized. Create Java Log4J log file in Config."internal.pipelineDir", named after the project.
        • Set and store LOG_FILE and LOG_APPEND in System properties to be used by log4j.properties
        • Print cached messages generated prior to Log file initialization to log file as INFO
        • Print Config property values to log file as INFO
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the log file
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to create the log file or print Config properties

      • logConfig

        public static void logConfig()
        Prints Config properties to the Java log file.

      • warn

        public static void warn(Class<?> myClass,
                        String msg)
        Print log level WARN message.
        Parameters:
        myClass - Logging class
        msg - Message to log

      • logWelcomeMsg

        protected static void logWelcomeMsg()
                             throws Exception
        Print welcome message.
        Message includes BioLockJ version BioLockJUtil.getVersion(), lab citation, and freeware blurb.
        Throws:
        Exception - if errors occur

      • validateLogLevel

        protected static String validateLogLevel()
                                  throws Exception
        Validate log level is configured to one of the valid Log4J options: DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR
        Returns:
        valid logLevel (DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR)
        Throws:
        Exception - if Config."project.logLevel" parameter is missing or invalid
